natural problem:
If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = -8,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{vmatrix}.\]
natural solution: Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = -8,$ $ad - bc = -8.$  Then \[\begin{vmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{vmatrix} = bc - ad = \boxed{8}.\](Why does this make sense geometrically?)

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "a * d - b * c = -8"
shows  "b * c - a * d = 8"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = -8,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 8
 ### Proof
 Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = -8,$ $ad - bc = -8.$  Then \[\begin{vmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{vmatrix} = bc - ad = \boxed{8}.\](Why does this make sense geometrically?)
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "a * d - b * c = -8"
shows  "b * c - a * d = 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If $ad - bc = -8$, find the value of $bc - ad$. The final answer is $8$.

 proof-

a_4.informal problem: If the result of multiplying $a$ by $d$ and then subtracting the product of $b$ and $c$ equals $-8$, what is the result of multiplying $b$ by $c$ and then subtracting the product of $a$ and $d$? The final answer is $8$.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "abs (a * d - b * c) = 8"
shows  "abs (b * c - a * d) = 8"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = -8,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 8
 ### Proof
 Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = -8,$ $ad - bc = -8.$  Then \[\begin{vmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{vmatrix} = bc - ad = \boxed{8}.\](Why does this make sense geometrically?)
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "abs (a * d - b * c) = 8"
shows  "abs (b * c - a * d) = 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
